C. elegans Transparency | WormClassroom

Wildtype C. elegans Embryo Development

 

As C. elegans is transparent, the dividing cell can be observed and recorded. This movie recorded a C. elegans from a zygote to a worm before hatching.

Adult Worm

Click see movies (with and without labels):

{width=”150” height=”105”}      {width=”150” height=”98”}

This C. elegans movie is from the Goldstein lab. The worm is a hermaphrodite (notice its tail is pointed). As it is transparent, one is able to observe its internal structures, e.g. eggs, intestine.

Credits

  • Wild type embrogenesis movie: Kevin O’Connell, National Institute of Diabetes & Digestive & Kidney Diseases (NIDDK).
  • Adult C. elegans movie: Bob Goldstein, Goldstein Lab.
